title: John Boudebza
text:
John Boudebza (born 6 June 1990) is a French professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays for <a href="Palau%20Broncos">Palau Broncos</a> and previously <a href="L%C3%A9zignan%20Sangliers">Lézignan Sangliers</a> in the <a href="Elite%20One%20Championship">Elite One Championship</a>, <a href="London%20Broncos">London Broncos</a> in the <a href="Kingstone%20Press%20Championship">Kingstone Press Championship</a> and <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a> in the <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a> and at international level for <a href="France%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">France</a>. His position is .
Club career.
Early career.
Boudebza played in the <a href="Elite%20One%20Championship">Elite One Championship</a> for <a href="SM%20Pia%20XIII">SM Pia XIII</a> and <a href="L%C3%A9zignan%20Sangliers">Lézignan Sangliers</a>. His father, <a href="Hadj%20Boudebza">Hadj Boudebza</a> is a former rugby league player who played for <a href="Paris%20Saint-Germain%20Rugby%20League">Paris Saint-Germain</a>, <a href="AS%20Saint-Est%C3%A8ve">AS Saint-Estève</a> and for <a href="France%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">France</a>, disputing the <a href="1995%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">1995 Rugby League World Cup</a>.
Hull KR.
Boudebza joined <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a> on a one-year deal prior to the <a href="Super%20League%20XX">2015 Super League season</a>. He appeared in the <a href="2015%20Challenge%20Cup">2015 Challenge Cup</a> Final for Hull KR. Boudebza left Hull KR following their relegation from Super League in 2016.
FC Lézignan XIII.
On 30 Nov 2016 it was reported that he had signed for <a href="FC%20L%C3%A9zignan%20XIII">FC Lézignan XIII</a> in the <a href="Elite%20One%20Championship">Elite One Championship</a>
London Broncos.
After taking time off to heal long-standing injuries following his departure from Hull KR, Boudebza joined the <a href="London%20Broncos">London Broncos</a> in July 2017.
International career.
Boudebza made his international début for <a href="France%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">France</a> in a victory over <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Wales</a> in the <a href="2014%20European%20Cup%20%28rugby%20league%29">2014 European Cup</a>. He scored his first international point with a field goal against <a href="Ireland%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Ireland</a> in the <a href="2015%20European%20Cup">2015 European Cup</a> competition. He also played for France in their 2015 European Cup mid-tournament test-match against England. He was a part what was considered a 'weakened' French side due to injury and it showed with an appalling showing against their opponents.
